_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Rich Products Corporation - Arlington Facility produces whipped toppings which are frozen for shipment by using an ammonia refrigeration system.  The ammonia refrigeration system contains approximately 40,300 pounds of anhydrous ammonia which is liquified under pressure.

Rich Products Corporation - Arlington Facility endeavors to eliminate accidents and health hazards to Associates, customers, and the community by having procedures to provide Associates educational training, safe working conditions, and the means to increase awareness of potential dangers.  Rich Products Corporation - Arlington Facility's objective is to prevent unwanted releases of ammonia into locations that could potentially expose Associates and others to serious hazards.  An effective program requires a systematic approach to evaluate the entire ammonia refrigeration system.  Workplace and process safety are major concerns to management and Associates alike.  The prevention and mitigation of unwanted releases of ammonia into locations that could expose Associates and the community to serious hazards is of primary concern.

Rich Products Corporation - Arlington Facility has developed this program in accordance with OSHA Title 29 CFR 1910.119 and USEPA Title 40 CFR Part 68.  The program is designed to inform all Associates of the hazards of ammonia, procedures for the safe use of ammonia, and the steps taken for the safety of Associates in the event of a release or spill (i.e., emergency response plan, management of change procedures, preventative maintenance program, associate training, etc.).  In addition, Rich Products Corporation has generated the "Rich Products Corporation Standards for Safety Performance" which outlines the corporate policy for safety policies, safety procedures, and sample programs to be implemented at each facility owned by Rich Products Corporation.

Rich Products Corporation - Arlington Facility has not had an accidental release over the last five years.

The emergency

response plan was written to comply with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119(n), USEPA 40 CFR 68.95, and OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38.  These regulations establish the parameters to be included in the emergency response plan.  

The Facility will be removing and replacing the existing ammonia refrigeration system engine rooms with a brand new engine room designed and constructed to the current codes and standards.
